title: Akshay Suresh
text:
AI Researcher | Data Scientist | Freelancer

Hi there! I am Akshay Suresh. Professionaly, I love developing artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms to tackle challenging real-world problems and generate sustainable benefit for humanity.
Building on my educational training in physics and data science, I am excited to make impactful contributions in the following domains.

AI for climate change
AI for healthcare
Environment perception algorithms for autonomous vehicles
Pioneering safe artificial general intelligence

Outside of work, I enjoy following cricket, playing board games, and exploring natural wonders. Visit my About and Projects pages to hear of my experiences in and beyond the workplace.

title: About Me
text:
Research Experience





10/2023 – Present


Freelance AI Researcher Upskilling






08/2017 – 06/2023


Graduate Researcher, Cornell University, Ithaca, NY, USA AI and Signal Processing for Automated Astrophysical Event Discovery Deep Learning Signal Processing Python Pytorch Radio Astronomy





06/2022 – 08/2022


Machine Learning Researcher, Frontier Development Lab USA Time Series Forecast of Earthquake Rates from Underground Carbon Storage Time Series Forecasting LSTM Pytorch Teamwork Climate Adaptation





09/2021 – 06/2022


Visiting Researcher, University of California, Berkeley, USA Software Development for Radar Detection from Alien Worlds Production Code Development Python Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence






 Technical Skills





Programming


Python (pytorch, scikit-learn, numpy, pandas, matplotlib, plotly), bash scripting, SQL, \(\LaTeX\), HTML





Machine learning




Supervised learning:


Linear regression, lasso & ridge regularization


Decision trees, random forest


Support vector machine (SVM)


k-nearest neighbors (kNN)


Convolutional neural networks (CNN)


Recurrent neural networks (RNN)


Long short-term memory networks (LSTM)




Unsupervised learning:


k-means clustering


Gaussian mixture models (GMM)




Principal component analysis (PCA)


Stochastic gradient descent (SGD)


Adam optimization







Software Engineering


Production code development, high performance computing (HPC)

 Recreational Activities

I have been an avid cricket fan since my teenage years. Whenever feasible, I attempt to witness major cricketing events live in stadiums worldwide. A personal cricketing highlight for me was attending the World T20 final 2022 at the magnificient Melbourne Cricket Ground. ::: {layout_ncol=3}    :::
I enjoy destressing from work through board games and food. My favorite board game haunts include Gameistry Entertainment (Chennai, India) and Victory Point Cafe (Berkeley, CA, USA). I maintain here a growing list of board games I have played since 2020. Hoping to expand this list further in the coming years!

title: Refereed Publications
text:
0000-0002-5389-7806

 Journal articles
Astronomy: 9 publications during 2016 – 2023 (7 first-author, 2 co-author).

[Reuters press release] Suresh, A., Gajjar, V., Nagarajan, P., Sheikh, S. Z., et al., (9 authors), A 4–8 GHz Galactic Center Search for Periodic Technosignatures, 2023 AJ 165 255.
Suresh, A., Cordes, J. M., Chatterjee, S., Gajjar, V., et al. (9 authors), 4–8 GHz Fourier-domain Searches for Galactic Center Pulsars, 2022 ApJ 933 121.
Suresh, A., Cordes, J. M., Chatterjee, S., Gajjar, V., et al. (7 authors), 4–8 GHz Spectrotemporal Emission from the Galactic Center Magnetar PSR J1745—2900, 2021 ApJ 921 101.
Suresh, A., Chatterjee, S., Cordes, J. M., & Crawford, F., An Arecibo Search for Fast Radio Transients from M87, 2021 ApJ 920 16.
Suresh, A., Chatterjee, S., Cordes, J. M., Bastian, T. S. & Hallinan, G., Detection of 2–4 GHz Continuum Emission from \(\epsilon\) Eridani, 2020 ApJ 904 138.
Suresh, A., & Cordes, J. M., Induced Polarization from Birefringent Pulse Splitting in Magnetoionic Media, 2019 ApJ 870 29.
Suresh, A., Sharma, R., Oberoi, D., et al. (39 authors), Wavelet-based Characterization of Small-scale Solar Emission Features at Low Radio Frequencies, 2017 ApJ 843 19.
Gajjar, V., et al. (22 authors including Suresh, A.), Searching for Broadband Pulsed Beacons from 1883 Stars Using Neural Networks, 2022 ApJ 932 81.
Gajjar, V., et al. (26 authors including Suresh, A.), The Breakthrough Listen Search For Intelligent Life Near the Galactic Center I, 2021 AJ 162 33.



 Conference Proceedings

Vaillancourt, P. Z., et al. (9 authors including Suresh, A.), Reproducible and Portable Workflows for Scientific Computing and HPC in the Cloud, PEARC 2020.
Oberoi, D., et al. (10 authors including Suresh, A.), Solar Science at Metric Radio Wavelengths: Coming of Age, IAU Symposium 340, 2018.
Sharma, R., Oberoi, D., Suresh, A., & Arjunwardkar, M., Quantifying Weak Non-thermal Meterwave Solar Emission Using Non-imaging Techniques, IAU Symposium 340, 2018.



 Dissertations

PhD thesis: Suresh, A., Radio Transient Searches from Millisecond to Hour-long Time Scales, Cornell University, USA, 2023.
MS thesis: Suresh, A., Investigation of Small Scale Weak Solar Emissions at Low Radio Frequencies, IISER Pune, India, 2017.
